2. JVM (Java Virtual Machine), JDK (Java Development Kit), JRE (Java Runtime Environment) l√† g√¨ ?

3. C√°ch Java ho·∫°t ƒë·ªông (Compile -> Run)

3.3. T√≠nh nƒÉng n·ªïi b·∫≠t c·ªßa Java runtime:

4. To√°n t·ª≠ (Operators)

  • Java h·ªó tr·ª£ nhi·ªÅu lo·∫°i to√°n t·ª≠ cho c√°c ph√©p t√≠nh to√°n v√† logic:

     |--------------------------------------------------------------|
     | To√°n t·ª≠ |      Ch·ª©c nƒÉng                | V√≠ d·ª•              |
     |--------------------------------------------------------------|
     |    +    |     C·ªông                      | a + b              |

     |    *    |     Nh√¢n                      | a * b              |
     |    /    |     Chia                      | a / b              |
     |    %    |     Chia l·∫•y ph·∫ßn d∆∞          | a % b              |
     |    ++   |     TƒÉng 1 (prefix/postfix)   | ++a ho·∫∑c a++       |

     |--------------------------------------------------------------|

     |--------------------------------------------------|
     |  To√°n t·ª≠  |           √ù nghƒ©a                    |
     |--------------------------------------------------|
     |   ==      | B·∫±ng                                 |
     |   !=      | Kh√¥ng b·∫±ng                           |

     |   <=      | Nh·ªè h∆°n ho·∫∑c b·∫±ng                    |
     |--------------------------------------------------|
     - Tr·∫£ v·ªÅ gi√° tr·ªã **boolean (true/false)

c. To√°n t·ª≠ G√°n (Assignment Operators)

     |--------------------------------------------------|
     | To√°n t·ª≠  | V√≠ d·ª•     | √ù nghƒ©a                   |
     |--------------------------------------------------|
     | =        | a = b    | G√°n gi√° tr·ªã c·ªßa b cho a    |
     | +=       | a += 1   | a = a + 1                  |
     | -=       | a -= 2   | a = a - 2                  |
     | *=       | a *= 3   | a = a * 3                  |
     | /=       | a /= 4   | a = a / 4                  |

     |--------------------------------------------------|

d. To√°n t·ª≠ Logic (Logical Operators)

     |---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
     | To√°n t·ª≠ | T√™n g·ªçi       | √ù nghƒ©a                                            | V√≠ d·ª•         | K·∫øt qu·∫£ v√≠ d·ª•  |
     |---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
     |    &&   | Logical AND   | ƒê√∫ng n·∫øu c·∫£ hai bi·ªÉu th·ª©c tr∆∞·ªõc ƒë·ªÅu ƒë√∫ng           | true && false | false          |
     |    ||   | Logical OR    | ƒê√∫ng n·∫øu √≠t nh·∫•t m·ªôt bi·ªÉu th·ª©c ƒë√∫ng                | true || false | true           |
     |    !    | Logical NOT   | Ph·ªß ƒë·ªãnh gi√° tr·ªã boolean(tr·∫£ v·ªÅ gi√° tr·ªã ng∆∞·ª£c l·∫°i) | !true         | false          |
     |---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|

e. To√°n t·ª≠ Bit (Bitwise Operators)

       |--------------------------|
   | To√°n t·ª≠ | T√°c d·ª•ng       |

   | &       | AND            |

   | <<      | D·ªãch tr√°i      |
   | >>      | D·ªãch ph·∫£i      |
   |--------------------------|

f. Ternary Operator (To√°n t·ª≠ ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán 3 ng√¥i):

  • C√∫ ph√°p: <ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán> ? <gi√° tr·ªã n·∫øu true> : <gi√° tr·ªã n·∫øu false>

III. C√¢u l·ªánh ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán v√† V√≤ng l·∫∑p (Control Flow Statements)

2. Switch case

   }

L∆∞u √Ω:

  • N·∫øu kh√¥ng c√≥ Break, ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh s·∫Ω ch·∫°y li√™n ti·∫øp c√°c case sau(g·ªçi l√† fall through).
  • T·ª´ Java 14+ c√∫ ph√°p switch m·ªõi v·ªõi ->.

3. V√≤ng l·∫∑p for, while, do-while

b. while - l·∫∑p khi ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán c√≤n ƒë√∫ng

c. do-while ‚Äì lu√¥n ch·∫°y √≠t nh·∫•t 1 l·∫ßn

     do {
         System.out.println("Do-while l·∫ßn " + i);

- Kh√°c bi·ªát:

  • while: ki·ªÉm tra tr∆∞·ªõc ‚Äì n·∫øu sai, kh√¥ng ch·∫°y.
  • do-while: ch·∫°y tr∆∞·ªõc ‚Äì ki·ªÉm tra sau, lu√¥n ch·∫°y √≠t nh·∫•t 1 l·∫ßn.

IV. M·∫£ng v√† Chu·ªói (Arrays and Strings)

  • Duy·ªát m·∫£ng:

b. M·∫£ng 2 chi·ªÅu (2D array)

   int[][] matrix2 = {{1, 2}, {3, 4}, {5, 6}};

  • Duy·ªát m·∫£ng:

    for (int i = 0; i &lt; matrix.length; i++) {

 for (int j = 0; j &lt; matrix[i].length; j++) {

    System.out.print(matrix[i][j] + " ");

 }
  System.out.println();
}

2. Duy·ªát m·∫£ng b·∫±ng for-each (Enhanced for loop)

-D√πng ƒë·ªÉ duy·ªát qua c√°c ph·∫ßn t·ª≠ trong m·∫£ng (array) ho·∫∑c collection (List, Set,‚Ä¶) m√† kh√¥ng c·∫ßn ch·ªâ s·ªë (index).

       // x·ª≠ l√Ω v·ªõi bi·∫øn
     }

- L∆∞u √Ω:

  • for-each kh√¥ng d√πng ƒë∆∞·ª£c khi b·∫°n c·∫ßn bi·∫øt ch·ªâ s·ªë ph·∫ßn t·ª≠ (index) ho·∫∑c mu·ªën s·ª≠a gi√° tr·ªã trong m·∫£ng.
  • N·∫øu c·∫ßn th√™m/x√≥a ph·∫ßn t·ª≠ trong v√≤ng l·∫∑p, n√™n d√πng Iterator thay v√¨ for-each.

3. String v√† thao t√°c chu·ªói (substring, replace, split, etc.)

       |-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
   | Ph∆∞∆°ng th·ª©c        | M√¥ t·∫£                               | V√≠ d·ª•                                            |
   |-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
   | substring()        | C·∫Øt chu·ªói con                       | "hello".substring(1, 3) ‚Üí "el"                   |

   | equalsIgnoreCase() | So s√°nh b·ªè qua hoa/th∆∞·ªùng           | "Java".equalsIgnoreCase("java") ‚Üí true           |
   |-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|

4. StringBuilder, StringBuffer ‚Äì hi·ªáu su·∫•t thao t√°c chu·ªói

  • StringBuilder :

    • D√πng trong c√°c ·ª©ng d·ª•ng single-thread.
  • StringBuffer:

    • Nh∆∞ng do vi·ªác ƒë·ªìng b·ªô n√™n s·∫Ω ch·∫≠m h∆°n StringBuilder.

5. So s√°nh hi·ªáu su·∫•t

     |---------------------------------------------------------------------|
     | T√≠nh nƒÉng             | String    | StringBuilder | StringBuffer    |
     |---------------------------------------------------------------------|
     | T√≠nh b·∫•t bi·∫øn         | C√≥        | Kh√¥ng         | Kh√¥ng           |
     | Thread-safe           | Kh√¥ng     | Kh√¥ng         | C√≥              |

     | D√πng trong m√¥i tr∆∞·ªùng | VB·∫•t k·ª≥   | Single-thread | Multi-thread    |
     |---------------------------------------------------------------------|

V. L·∫≠p tr√¨nh h∆∞·ªõng ƒë·ªëi t∆∞·ª£ng - OOP (Object-Oriented Programming)

1. L·ªõp v√† ƒê·ªëi t∆∞·ª£ng(Class & Object)

2. T√≠nh ƒë√≥ng g√≥i(Encapsulation)

3. K·∫ø th·ª´a(Inheritance)

4. ƒêa h√¨nh (Polymorphism)

    • ƒêa h√¨nh l√∫c bi√™n d·ªãch(Compile-time Polymorphism), th∆∞·ªùng ƒë∆∞·ª£c bi·∫øt ƒë·∫øn qua n·∫°p ch·ªìng ph∆∞∆°ng th·ª©c(Method Overloading). t·ª©c l√† trong m·ªôt l·ªõp, ch√∫ng ta c√≥ th·ªÉ c√≥ nhi·ªÅu ph∆∞∆°ng th·ª©c c√πng t√™n nh∆∞ng kh√°c nhau v·ªÅ s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng ho·∫∑c ki·ªÉu d·ªØ li·ªáu c·ªßa tham s·ªë, ho·∫∑c d·ªØ li·ªáu tr·∫£ v·ªÅ.     • ƒêa h√¨nh l√∫c ch·∫°y(Runtime Polymorphism), th∆∞·ªùng ƒë∆∞·ª£c bi·∫øt ƒë·∫øn qua ghi ƒë√® ph∆∞∆°ng th·ª©c(Method Overriding). 5. Tr·ª´u t∆∞·ª£ng (Abstraction)
